id: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Orchestra Wellington is New Zealand’s oldest professional regional orchestra. Its busy concert series includes music from classical, romantic, and contemporary periods. You’ll also see it regularly performing with the Orpheus Choir, Royal New Zealand Ballet, and New Zealand Opera.
For its 2025 season, ‘The Dictator’s Shadow’, the orchestra focuses in part on Dimitri Shostakovich. The programme includes masterpieces that symbolise the artist’s struggle and resilience under repression and political control. Coupled with works from other composers, the concerts feature local and international soloists.

id: Come Together 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Come Together 2025
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Recreating three entire classic rock albums live is no easy feat. The crew from Come Together are up for the task — they have been doing it for five years. The group of famous New Zealand musicians has organised a stellar lineup for 2025. First up they aim to capture the raw emotion of Neil Young’s album ‘Live Rust’. Later in the year, they’ll tackle the atmospheric complexity of Pink Floyd’s ‘Dark Side of the Moon’, followed by the thunderous power of Led Zeppelin’s album ‘Led Zeppelin II’. 
Each of these legendary albums will be performed in its entirety — track by track, back-to-back. There will also be an additional bonus set of deep cuts and classic hits. Some of the most talented musicians in the country pour everything they have into recreating this music with precision and passion. Look out for Reb Fountain, Jon Toogood, Julia Deans, Luke Buda, Jol Mulholland, and many more. Expect extended solos and spontaneous moments of magic. The electrifying energy between performers makes each show unforgettable.

id: Pub Choir — Average at Best-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Pub Choir — Average at Best
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Sing out loud and sing out strong with a cast of eager strangers. Pub Choir takes the concept of ‘a bit of a sing-along’ to a whole new level. You don’t have to know how to sing to attend. In fact, creator Astrid Jorgensen assumes you’re not going to be the best or worst singer in the world. She wants all the average people to come, laugh, and learn a song en masse. Pub Choir has been running for eight years now, and Astrid regularly fills big venues with happy punters. Singing together creates an enticing sense of community. 
What will happen at the show? Astrid says it’s an entirely improvised, comedy music lesson, where you are the main attraction. “There’ll be no auditions and no homework. Just bring your voice and we’ll do the rest.” You’ll get taught one song in three-part harmony and have a lot of fun on the way. 
By purchasing a ticket, you are giving your consent to be filmed and photographed during this show.

id: Rob Thomas — All Night Days Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Rob Thomas — All Night Days Tour
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The star of popular 90s band Matchbox Twenty brings his first-ever solo tour to Wellington. Rob Thomas is a multi-platinum singer-songwriter. His All Night Days Tour celebrates his forthcoming sixth solo album ‘All Night Days’. It also coincides with the 20th anniversary of his acclaimed debut solo record ‘Something to Be’. Fans are in for a treat as artists of this calibre don’t often play intimate theatre settings. 
The tour promises to deliver the captivating live performances that Thomas is known for. Audiences can expect timeless hits including Lonely No More, This Is How A Heart Breaks, Her Diamonds, and Street Corner Symphony. He’ll also be performing new singles as well as Matchbox Twenty favourites like 3am and Unwell. “After such amazing Matchbox shows in 2024, it’s so great to revisit the solo catalogue, and I can’t wait to come back and share these songs with my Kiwi fans. It’s going to be a very special run of shows,” said Rob.

id: Commodores Greatest Hits Tour-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Commodores Greatest Hits Tour
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
It’ll be easy like a Sunday morning to enjoy this group live. For the first time since 1977, Commodores return to New Zealand. Their Greatest Hits Tour is sure to thrill lovers of the Motown sound. Formed in 1968, Commodores have sold over 75 million records worldwide. It’s no wonder when you look at some of their famous songs. The concert is sure to include classic hits like Easy, Nightshift, Three Times a Lady, Brick House, Sail On, and many more. 
Commodores are one of the greatest Motown and R&B/funk artists of all time. For five decades, they have remained a force in the music industry. They have earned five number-one albums, 20 top-ten singles, and 15 top-ten albums. Get ready for a night of grooving when the legends come to Wellington.
Note: Ronald LaPread will not be appearing in this show.

id: Tina: The Ultimate Tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Tina: The Ultimate Tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Her distinctive husky delivery captivated audiences from the 60s through to the 90s. Tina Turner is a rock and roll icon. She had a string of hits across four decades and was renowned for high-octane stage shows. In ‘Tina: The Ultimate Tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll’, you’ll hear all her energetic rock and rhythm and blues hits. Listen to Simply The Best, What’s Love Got To Do With It, River Deep Mountain High, Proud Mary, We Don’t Need Another Hero, Private Dancer, It Takes Two, and many more. You’ll see why Tina became one of the 20th century’s biggest names in music. 
South African Caroline Borole will pick up the microphone to pay homage to Tina Turner. She has previously been seen on ‘South African Idols’. Joining her on stage will be a band with a wild brass section. There’ll also be backing vocalists and dancers to make this simply the best tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll.

id: Kirk Franklin — The World Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Kirk Franklin — The World Tour
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
He’s considered a transformative force in contemporary gospel music. Kirk Franklin is a trailblazer in his field, and he’s sharing his talents with a Wellington audience. Kirk is known for masterfully blending rhythm and blues, hip-hop, pop, and gospel. The 20-time Grammy Award-winning gospel artist has a unique sound that resonates across generations. 
For his Michael Fowler Centre performance, he’ll draw from his extensive repertoire, including his 2023 album ‘Father’s Day’. That release featured the number one hit single All Things which earned him Grammy number 20 in 2024. In 2025, he released the soul-stirring new single Do It Again which quickly connected with audiences. It reinforced his reputation to deliver messages that expand the reach of gospel into mainstream culture. Whether it’s in the studio or live on stage, Kirk continues to inspire millions. He connects with a message rooted in faith, love, and resilience.

id: Pixies-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Pixies
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
They influenced the sound of the 90s. American alt-rock band Pixies formed in 1986. Their jarring pop sound draws from punk rock and surf rock. Still popular more than 35 years later, they are heading to the St James Theatre for a two-night residency. In a unique twist, they’ll present two different concerts. On the first night, they’ll play two 90s classic albums in their entirety – ‘Bossanova’ and ‘Trompe Le Monde’. For the second night, they’ll play from their new album ‘The Night The Zombies Came’ plus other songs from their catalogue. 
Pixies are known for surreal lyrics, wild shifts in song structure, and dynamic contrast. They are said to have influenced other 90s bands like Nirvana, Radiohead, Smashing Pumpkins, and Weezer. Their tenth, and most recent album, ‘The Night the Zombies Came’ was received with critical acclaim. United Kingdom music magazine DIY stated, “Pixies remain one of the most consistent, influential bands on the planet.”

id: Wellington Opera — A Masked Ball-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Wellington Opera — A Masked Ball
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Local opera company Wellington Opera presents a grand production. ‘A Masked Ball’ (Un Ballo in Maschera) is one of Giuseppe Verdi’s great masterpieces. It contrasts the frivolity of a masquerade with high drama. For this production, Wellington Opera has gathered a cast made exclusively of New Zealand opera singers. Madeleine Pierard and Jared Holt return after headlining the 2024 production of ‘Tosca’. Joining them are Julien Van Mellaerts, Natasha Te Rupe Wilson, Kristin Darragh, and Morgan King. 
The opera is based on the true story of the 1792 assassination of King Gustavo III of Sweden. He was shot while attending a masked ball — a result of a political conspiracy. The staging, by Jacqueline Coats, promises to bring the dramatic storyline to life. Brian Castles-Onion will conduct Orchestra Wellington.

id: Herman’s Hermits-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Herman’s Hermits
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
English rock and pop group Herman’s Hermits formed in 1963. Still going strong 62 years later, the band heads to Wellington’s St James Theatre in 2025. Known for jaunty songs and often tongue-in-cheek vocal style, Herman’s Hermits had many transatlantic hits. With catchy tunes like Mrs Brown, You Got a Lovely Daughter, Henry the VIII, No Milk Today, and There’s a Kind of Hush, you’ll have plenty to tap along to. 
Herman’s Hermits was one of the ‘British Invasion’ bands that followed the success of The Beatles in the 1960s and 70s. They hit the American pop charts 22 times with songs that became rock’n’roll anthems all over the world. The Wellington Show promises to be as energetic and lively as they were six decades ago.

id: Creedence Clearwater Collective-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Creedence Clearwater Collective
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Take a walk back in time to enjoy some of the most famous music of the 60s and 70s. Creedence Clearwater Revival was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions. From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972 the band produced some highly memorable songs. Many of them are still regularly played today. The Creedence Clearwater Collective recreates the success of the original band. The Opera House stage in Wellington will come alive with a six-piece tribute band. There’ll be a guest saxophonist and a vocalist who emulates the distinct sounds of original vocalist John Fogerty. 
The night promises to be full of iconic tunes including songs they wrote and songs they covered. Listen to hits like Have You Ever Seen The Rain, Fortunate Son, Bad Moon Rising, and Proud Mary.

id: An Evening with Cowboy Junkies-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: An Evening with Cowboy Junkies
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Canadian band Cowboy Junkies returns to Wellington with its special mix of alternative country and folk-rock. Formed in 1985 when a lot of music was flashy and loud, the Canadian band has stayed their gentle course with whisper-close vocals and subtle instrumentation. Cowboy Junkies prove that there continues to be an audience waiting for something quiet, beautiful, and reflective. 
Cowboy Junkies will perform a range of songs from their four decades and 29 albums. Expect to hear hits from their 1988 multiplatinum album ‘The Trinity’ and the acclaimed 2023 album ‘Such Ferocious Beauty’. The band of four comprises siblings — Margo, Michael, and Pete Timmins, and bassist Alan Anton. This long-lasting group has never had a breakup or hiatus. It’s a testament to the appreciation they have for each other and their dedication to creating beautiful music.

id: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The beloved rock anthem ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’ turns 50 in 2025. To celebrate the anniversary of the British band Queen’s famous song, a tribute act is touring and stopping in Wellington. The Opera House will pulsate to ‘Queen: It's a Kinda Magic’. The show will celebrate the legacy of Queen and its frontman Freddy Mercury. Think big sound, big screens, crazy lighting, and outlandish costumes. This is a real rock experience. 
Dominic Warren will take the lead performing lead vocals, guitar and piano. All songs are in Freddie’s original key. He’s also got the wit, charm, and bravado to pull off an homage to the ultimate rock vocalist. Get ready to mosh to ‘We Will Rock You,’ ‘We Are the Champions,’ ‘Radio Ga Ga,’ ‘I Want to Break Free,’ ‘Somebody to Love,’ ‘Don’t Stop Me Now,’ ‘Another One Bites the Dust,’ ‘A Kind of Magic,’ and of course, ‘Bohemian Rhapsody.’

id: Kaylee Bell — Cowboy Up Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Kaylee Bell — Cowboy Up Tour
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Wellington will be getting its ‘yeehaw’ on for a much-anticipated concert this November. New Zealand country-pop force Kaylee Bell rides into town to set up at the Michael Fowler Centre. Fans can expect a full-throttle live show featuring hits from her three studio albums, the most recent being ‘Nights Like This’ released in 2023. Have a listen out for viral, banjo-infused hits like Cowboy Up, Red Dirt Romeo, Boots N’ All, and Good Things.
As part of a five-city tour of the country this is her biggest headline show to date. It comes off the back of a whirlwind 18 months that’s seen Kaylee cement her place as one of Australasia’s leading country artists. She won Best Female Artist at the 2024 Golden Guitar Awards and Global Country Music Artist at the 2023 CMA awards. Kaylee has carved out a career that bridges Nashville polish with Kiwi grit. This concert promises to be her boldest and most exciting yet.

id: Ryan Adams-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Ryan Adams
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of his breakthrough debut album ‘Heartbreaker,’ multi-Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter Ryan Adams is set to embark on his ‘Heartbreaker’ tour. He will bring the album and more to audiences across Australia and New Zealand in October 2025. Known for his genre-defying sound, Ryan will deliver an intimate, acoustic set that showcases his expansive catalogue. 
Since its release in 2000, ‘Heartbreaker’ has become a cornerstone of Ryan Adams’ career, featuring tracks such as Oh My Sweet Carolina, Come Pick Me Up, and To Be Young (Is to Be Sad, Is to Be High). This tour offers a chance to experience these songs live.

id: Stardew Valley — Symphony of Seasons-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Stardew Valley — Symphony of Seasons
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The role-playing video game Stardew Valley has amassed a huge following since its creation in 2016. Now you can hear the music from the soundtrack played live by an orchestra. ‘Stardew Valley — Symphony of Seasons’ is a musical journey through many of the cherished songs that populate the video game’s soundscape. While a 35-piece orchestra brings the music to life, a screen above the stage will play footage from the game. Fans will be treated to original content exclusive to this concert. 
Stardew Valley is a farm life simulation role-playing video game. Players take the role of a character who inherits their deceased grandfather’s dilapidated farm. Gamers watch their farm grow throughout the seasons and explore some of the valley’s locations. The music in the concert will transport you to some of those locations. Visit Pelican Town to the Skull Cavern, Ginger Island to Calico Desert, the Wizard’s Tower and more.

id: Cliff Richard-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Cliff Richard
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
One of the greatest hitmakers in British music history is heading to New Zealand shores for the first time in 12 years. Sir Cliff Richard has a string of chart-topping hits to his name. The pop legend will sing some of his biggest songs at Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre. Now 84 years old, the ever-youthful icon has produced 14 number-one singles and seven number-one albums across a 66-year career. Fans will be treated to a setlist packed with timeless classics. Bop along to Living Doll, We Don’t Talk Anymore, Devil Woman, and plenty more. Known for his energy, charisma, and enduring stage presence, Cliff continues to capture hearts and inspire audiences.
Since his debut in 1958 with Move It!, Cliff has delivered hit after hit. He’s sold over 250 million records worldwide, securing his place among the best-selling artists of all time.

id: NZSO — Mana Moana-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: NZSO — Mana Moana
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
It’s an amalgamation of symphony and song. ‘Mana Moana’ is a unique concert presenting the sounds of the Pacific. The New Zealand Symphony Orchestra has joined forces with the Signature Choir to display traditional and contemporary music from the islands. The Michael Fowler Centre will swell when the 80-strong choir sing songs from Samoa, Tonga, Fiji, Cook Islands, Niue, and Tokelau. 
“We are excited for our communities to see Mana Moana in person. Partnering with a world-class orchestra to sing songs that are prominent and significant to our Pasifika communities provides a huge sense of pride. It’s hard to not get emotional when performing.” says Signature Choir Music Director Helen Tupai. The programme will include ‘Faliu le la’ – a song that depicts the beauty of Samoa’s beautiful landscape. Audiences will also hear ‘Isa lei’ – a Fijian farewell song, and ‘Siueli o e pasifiki’ written by Queen Salote Tupou III. This song proclaims her love for her beloved country.

id: The Beatles By Candlelight-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: The Beatles By Candlelight
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Since 1960, the songs of The Beatles have captured the imaginations of generations. The band’s timeless classics have been playing across the airwaves for 65 years. Now they are being celebrated in a live concert at The Opera House in Wellington. Lower the lights and settle down to enjoy The Beatles By Candlelight. 
A live band will accompany a talented cast of West End singers. Together they’ll recreate over 40 of The Beatles’ hits, including Help!, Hey Jude, Let it Be, All You Need Is Love, Yesterday, and plenty more. All will be performed under the intimate ambience of candlelight. So, get ready to twist and shout the night away at this euphoric sing-along spectacular.

id: Coal Miner’s Daughter-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Coal Miner’s Daughter
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
American country music singer and songwriter Loretta Lynn had a career spanning six decades. Her incredible life is celebrated in ‘Coal Miner’s Daughter’ at The Opera House in October. Audiences will be captivated by brilliant storytelling and performances. 
Follow Loretta Lynn’s life from her early days in the hills of Kentucky to a tempestuous marriage, and massive music-world success. During her career, she nurtured enduring bonds with country and western stars. Among her friends were artists Patsy Cline, Conway Twitty, Tammy Wynette, Dolly Parton, and Willie Nelson. The performance will include songs from many of these icons. Hear I Fall To Pieces, You Ain’t Woman Enough To Take My Man, Crazy, Walkin’ After Midnight, Stand By Your Man, After The Fire Is Gone, and more. 
Loretta Lynn was known for her bedazzled floor length gowns, and gravity-defying hair. Amber Joy Poulton, the singer playing her on stage, is sure to do her extravagant style justice. Joining her are Lizzie Moore (as Patsy Cline) and Denis Surmon (as Conway Twitty and Willie Nelson) along with band The Holy Men.

id: The Bruce Springsteen Experience-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: The Bruce Springsteen Experience
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Relive some of the best anthems of the 80s and 90s. The Bruce Springsteen Experience is a show dedicated to honouring the timeless music of Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band. Featuring a nine-piece band, this electrifying performance will deliver a brilliant blend of live music and visuals. 2025 marks the 50th anniversary of the release of Bruce’s iconic album ‘Born to Run’.  This tribute concert will perform the album in its entirety, along with a selection of The Boss’s greatest hits. 
Enjoy all his best songs like Thunder Road, Jungleland, She’s the One, Tenth Avenue Freeze-Out, and plenty more.

id: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever and the George Ellis Orchestra-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever and the George Ellis Orchestra
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
You’re invited to put on your boogie shoes and salute the Bee Gees album ‘Saturday Night Fever’. Released in 1977, the album defined a disco generation. Tribute act Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever and the George Ellis Orchestra come to The Opera House in August 2025. They’ll play chart-busters from that album plus songs from other bands from the 70s like K.C. & The Sunshine Band, and The Trammps. Special guests Debora McLane (niece of the Bee Gees) and Roslyn Loxton join the tribute band on stage. 
In a two-act orchestrated performance, you’ll hear some of the best songs written by the Gibb brothers. Groove along to tracks like You Should Be Dancing, Stayin’ Alive, Jive Talkin’, Disco Inferno, More Than A Woman, Warm Ride, and so much more. 
The album ‘Saturday Night Fever’ was the biggest-selling sound recording between 1977 and 1980. It was awarded Album of the Year at the 1979 Grammys and stayed in the Top 200 for 29 consecutive months. It made Barry Gibb the first solo songwriter in history to have three consecutive number ones, and four songs in the top ten simultaneously.

id: A Celtic Christmas — A Taste of Ireland-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: A Celtic Christmas — A Taste of Ireland
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description: Prepare for a night of enchantment from the Emerald Isles. Some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians are bringing the spirit of Christmas to Wellington. A Celtic Christmas – A Taste of Ireland promises to be a blend of melodic folk mashups, a cappella tap battles, and heartwarming storytelling.

id: Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Sharon Van Etten’s music blends elements of folk, indie rock, and dream pop. Over the past 16 years, audiences have come to expect a gothic stage presence (think 6-inch black patent leather stilettos) and personal song lyrics. 
This concert follows on from the release of Sharon’s seventh studio album ‘Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory’. Despite being 16 years into her rock career, this is the first album with the band. It shows Sharon’s willingness to continually reinvent herself. The Attachment Theory includes Devra Hoff on bass guitar and backing vocals, Teeny Lieberson on keys, guitar, and backing vocals, and Jorge Balbi on drums. 
Sharon’s talent doesn’t stop at just musician and singer-songwriter. She is also an actress. She starred as Rachel in Netflix mystery drama The OA and has appeared in the feature films Never Rarely Sometimes Always and How It Ends.

id: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The NZSO’s reputation for artistic excellence attracts many of the world’s leading musicians, conductors, and soloists. In 2025 American mezzo-soprano and multi-Grammy Award winner Joyce DiDonato leads the star-studded international list. At 26, British saxophonist Jess Gillam is the youngest soloist to perform with the NZSO. Japanese conductor Masaaki Suzuki lends his skills to interpret Baroque works. 
Wellington shows are hosted in the Michael Fowler Centre, home of the NZSO. The touring programme will see the orchestra perform over 100 concerts in over 30 communities. Be among over 100,000 people across the motu who experience live orchestra music.

id: Tami Neilson: Neon Cowgirl Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Tami Neilson: Neon Cowgirl Tour
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
New Zealand’s own international country star, Tami Neilson, is back. Fresh off a tour around the United States she presents the Neon Cowgirl Tour. Her glorious voice and powerful live performances have won admiration and support from some of country music’s biggest names and fans worldwide. Tami will perform songs from her new album ‘Neon Cowgirl’ along with songs from across her entire career. Her latest album (out 11 July) is one of the year’s most highly anticipated releases. It follows the success of singles You’re Gonna Fall, and Borrow My Boots. 
2025 has been a landmark year for Tami. She’s had an invitation to perform around the United States with the touring Outlaw Festival (the brainchild of Willie Nelson). This is on top of performing at Merlefest, Willie’s Fourth of July Picnic, The Grand Ole Opry, and a European tour.

id: NZ Opera — The Monster in the Maze-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: NZ Opera — The Monster in the Maze
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
In an exciting and unusual twist to operatic tradition, New Zealand Opera is producing a show where amateurs sing on stage with professionals. ‘The Monster in the Maze’ retells the myth of the minotaur. The groundbreaking work is community-focused and community-driven. In the performance, community singers and instrumentalists stand shoulder-to-shoulder with their professional counterparts.
When King Minos defeats the Athenians, he decides to punish them by destroying their hope for the future. Every year, the king compels the conquered Athenians to send him their youth. He gives them to the minotaur, a terrible beast at the centre of his island’s maze. The youth are not willing to accept their fate. The story is about resistance, justice, and finding power in collectivism.
‘The Monster in the Maze’ has been praised by audiences, participants, and reviewers worldwide. Its Aotearoa debut season is directed by Anapela Polataivao. Anapela is known for directing the feature movie ‘Red, White & Brass’ (2023), and live theatre piece ‘Wild Dogs Under My Skirt’.

id: Paul Kelly-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Paul Kelly
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Paul Kelly’s albums have ranged from bluegrass and country to funk and soul. The Australian has written and sung a superb catalogue of love songs spanning more than 40 years. He’s heading to Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre to share his music. The tour will come a few months after the release of his next studio album ‘Fever Longing Still’. Joining Paul on stage is his band, who help bring these new songs to life. The album title comes from a line in ‘Sonnet 147’ by Shakespeare, whose writing has thrilled and inspired Paul ever since his school days. 
Bestowed with the Order of Australia in 2017 and with 17 ARIA awards and five APRA awards, Paul Kelly is a creative powerhouse. Australia is a constant in his song subjects. He regularly references its geographical landscape, its heroes and villains, and hopes and failings. 
For the Michael Fowler concert singer/songwriter Reb Fountain will open proceedings. The American-born Kiwi blends folk, art-pop, and rock into her act.

id: Elvis: An American Trilogy-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Elvis: An American Trilogy
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
What’s better than one Elvis Presley? Three Elvis Presleys. You’ll be all shook up when you experience ʻElvis: An American Trilogy’ at The Opera House. The show takes you on a spellbinding journey through three song eras of one of the most famous singers ever. First up: the sound of the 1950s. Louis Brown will capture the audience with the rockabilly sound and signature dance moves of Elvis’ early career. Arron Walker then takes the mic and recreates the role of Elvis in his movie years in the 1960s.  This period incorporates the singer’s famous straight-out-of-the-army look and the black-leather look. Finally, Steve Michaels pays homage to ‘Aloha from Hawaii’ — a famous 1973 concert broadcast across Asia and Oceania. All three performers create a magical atmosphere as befits ‘The King’. 
The sound, the moves, and the charm of Elvis Presley are lovingly recreated. Go and see it. It’s now or never.

id: Dope Lemon — Golden Wolf World Tour-Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Dope Lemon — Golden Wolf World Tour
venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Since his 2016 debut, Dope Lemon has cultivated a reputation for creating dreamy, laid-back grooves with introspective lyricism. Now the Australian singer-songwriter is going on tour. He’s traveling to Wellington to share his latest album, ‘Golden Wolf’. 
Dope Lemon is the moniker of Angus Stone. His music has struck a chord with audiences across the globe. His four previous albums have amassed over 700 million streams online. He’s also gained recognition for collaborations with revered Australian bands such as Winston Surfshirt. Co-writing credits include partnerships with the likes of Will Ferrell and Adam McKay. 
‘Golden Wolf’ is the shimmering fifth album for Dope Lemon. It blends reflective lyrics with wild sonic landscapes, all anchored by his trademark grooves. His live show promises to share new music with his usual high-quality production values.

id: Coldplay by Candlelight-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Coldplay by Candlelight
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
British band Coldplay have been around since 1997. Their mix of alt-rock and Brit pop has propelled them to international stardom. Now you get to experience their music in Wellington in a candlelit environment. Coldplay by Candlelight is the ultimate tribute act. Featuring a spectacular cast of world-class vocalists and an epic live band, the show presents Coldplay’s biggest hits like never before. 
This incredible concert will take you on the ‘Adventure Of A Lifetime’, with not just ‘A Sky Full Of Stars’, but a room full of candles. Get ready to hear all your favourites, from ‘Viva La Vida’ and ‘Fix You’, to ‘Yellow’, ‘The Scientist’, and many more. 
With over 100 million albums sold worldwide, Coldplay is one of the best-selling music acts of all time. They are also the first group in Spotify history to reach 90 million monthly listeners.

id: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
It’s a celebration of comedy, songs, and multifarious skills. Bill Bailey Vaudevillian is a wild ride through the lost art of vaudeville. Before streaming, before TV, before cinema, even before radio, there was vaudeville. 
A theatrical tradition invented mid-19th century in France, vaudeville was a type of variety show. It might have included popular and classical musicians, singers, dancers, magicians, ventriloquists, strongmen, impersonators, or clowns. 
British comedian Bill Bailey is familiar to Wellington audiences. He’s toured several popular stand-up shows to the Michael Fowler Centre. His latest will put his musical and humorous skills to the test. 
As a versatile musician and comedian, Bill is a modern-day vaudevillian. Come one, come all and experience his modern take on a classic tradition.

id: Abbie Chatfield — The Trauma Dump Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Abbie Chatfield — The Trauma Dump Tour
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Much-loved podcaster, TV star, and chronic over-sharer is returning to the stage. Abbie Chatfield is bringing her raw and unfiltered self to The Opera House for a one-off show. 
In 2023, Abbie thrilled Australian fans and critics with The Trauma Dump Tour. They commended the star for mounting the most relatable live show of the year. Publication The West Australian said her “vulnerability and hilarious insight” made for an unforgettable outing. Expect more of this when she brings the tour to New Zealand in September. 
Abbie rose to fame as a contestant in ‘The Bachelor Australia’. She has also starred in other reality shows and is a radio and television host. With over 478k Instagram followers and more than 445k on TikTok, Abbie has become a prominent social media personality. She’s well-known for her political activism, which she discusses on her podcast, ‘It’s A Lot with Abbie Chatfield’.

id: Circa Theatre 2025 Season-Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Circa Theatre 2025 Season
venue: Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Inside Circa Theatre’s waterfront venue, you’ll find two performance spaces. Both offer a smorgasbord of professional theatre throughout the year. Playwrights from international heavy hitters to brilliant Kiwi voices are represented. It also includes programming from comedies and cabarets to contemporary dance and pantomime. 
Before or after your show, visit the on-site café brasserie and restaurant, Chouchou. It opens out onto a deck, where you can take it views across the harbour. Look up to admire the art installation above. Called ‘Velarium’, it undulates in the wind mirroring the water in the harbour. 
Circa Theatre began its life in 1976. A breakaway group of actors and theatre practitioners decided that Aotearoa needed a new and innovative approach to theatre. Five decades later it is still pushing boundaries, making people laugh and cry, and creating theatrical memories. 
If you don’t have your own Circa memory yet, there’s an opportunity to create one nearly every night of the week.

id: World of WearableArt Show-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: World of WearableArt Show
venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Expect the unexpected as the magic and spectacle of the World of WearableArt (WOW) Show returns. The 2025 WOW Show ‘RISE’ will be an uplifting occasion, centred around the world’s best wearable art. Set in an illuminated cityscape, the show is a celebration of creativity. It brings its inspiration and innovation to the TSB Arena stage this September. 
Each night, New Zealand’s top performance talent brings extraordinary works of wearable art to life. “RISE is designed to make people feel inspired. It’s about spreading joy through creativity and creating a collective sense of awe and wonder,” says WOW Chief Executive Meg Williams.

id: Mamma Mia!-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Mamma Mia!
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Gimme, gimme, gimme a night of song and dance. Mamma Mia is the ultimate feel-good show. The stage musical has been wowing audiences since 1999. It’s due to wow Wellington audiences in 2025. Based on the songs of Swedish super-group ABBA, it features non-stop laughs and explosive dance numbers. 
This sunny, funny, musical unfolds on a Greek island paradise. On the eve of her wedding, a young woman plots to discover the identity of her father. She invites three men from her mother’s past to visit the island. The result is hilarious, joyful, and soul-searching. Get ready to tap your toe to some of ABBA’s most famous songs. You’ll hear hits like Voulez-Vous, Dancing Queen, Knowing Me Knowing You, Take a Chance on Me, Money, Money, Money, and The Winner Takes It All. Filled with timeless music this show has been translated into 16 languages. 70 million people can’t be wrong. Be a super trouper and go see it.

id: Explorers — The Age of Discovery with James May-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Explorers — The Age of Discovery with James May
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Learn about famous and not-so-famous explorers from Ice Age migrations through to space travel. In ‘Explorers — The Age of Discovery with James May’, the lives of great voyagers come to life on stage. James May will unravel breathtaking tales. Explore the earliest wanderings of ancient hunter-gatherers to intrepid, often obsessive, modern-day explorers. He covers people like Leif Erikson, John Cabot, James Cook’s navigator Tupaia, Stanley and Livingstone, and Gertrude Bell. There’s also time and space for, well, time and space. Talk about moonwalkers, astronauts, and the seemingly impossible challenges of interplanetary travel. 
James May is a British television presenter and award-winning journalist. He’s best known as a co-presenter of the motoring show ‘Top Gear’. He’s also known for his charisma live on stage and on screen. His storytelling combines with some exciting theatrical techniques. He will help you traverse deserts, scale mountains, and sail into the unknown. Those with an insatiable curiosity and an unquenchable thirst for discovery will be thoroughly entertained.
The show will feature haze and room scents for an immersive event experience.

id: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description: The Royal New Zealand Ballet (RNZB) pushes boundaries with its 2025 programme. Diverse and captivating works reflect the vision and influence of artistic director Ty King-Wall.

id: Illusionist Anthony Street-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Illusionist Anthony Street
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Illusionist Anthony Street is bringing his thrilling show to The Opera House. Experience breathtaking illusions, mind-bending magic, and Anthony’s boundless charisma. Prepare to be amazed as he conjures impossible feats before your eyes and blends traditional magic with modern spectacle. 

From larger-than-life illusions to mind tricks that will leave you questioning reality. Anthony’s show is packed with surprises and interactive moments. Watch as the audience becomes part of the magic. Share in the laughter, suspense, and pure joy that Anthony brings to every performance. This heart-pounding and heartwarming experience is perfect for audiences of all ages.

id: Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The bawdy comedy of Australian Kevin Bloody Wilson has been delighting and shocking audiences since the 70s. Now the outrageously funny (and outrageous) comedian is back. Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour is set to roll into The Opera House in September. He’ll perform a selection of his funniest songs, and irreverent stories — all infused with his wickedly rude sense of humour. 
Kevin’s journey to politically incorrect stardom started in 1977. He began by changing the words to other people’s songs, eventually writing some songs himself. At the time people were still being arrested for using some four-letter words in public. Audiences initially ostracised him for his rude and crude performances. Now, over 45 years later, the reverse applies. He has 350 million TikTok views, 4 million album sales, and 6 million tickets sold around the world. The 78-year-old shows no signs of slowing down. “There is just too much political correctness to incorrect!” he says.

id: The Morning Shift — Is That Us!?-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: The Morning Shift — Is That Us!?
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Real people and real talk. That’s what the three creators of The Morning Shift offer. Jordan Vaha’akolo, Brook Ruscoe, and Marc Peard have been having a yarn on their podcast five days a week for two years. They talk about culture, entertainment, and sports. It can be funny and thought-provoking. Now they’re taking the podcast on the road and visiting Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre. You can expect all the stuff you’re used to: deep kōrero , big laughs, and a few tears. It’s also likely there’ll be some spontaneous (and questionable) singing. 
From humble beginnings in a garage, The Morning Shift has had an amazing rise to the upper reaches of the podcast charts in Aotearoa. The trio’s brand of humorous and honest musings has earned them thousands of daily listeners. Rally the crew, book the babysitter, and get ready for a night that promises to shift you. As Jordan says, “I want people to leave with laughter still in their belly and hope in their hearts. Lessspushhhh.”

id: Luke Kidgell — Good Intentions-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Luke Kidgell — Good Intentions
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
You’ve seen him on the internet, now it’s time to see him in real life. Luke Kidgell established a reputation as a social media star. His YouTube content and podcasts cemented his comedic credentials. He’s since turned his hand to live shows. Now, following a successful tour of the United States, Canada, Australia, and Europe, Luke is coming to Wellington. His brand-new show, Good Intentions, is set to make The Opera House giggle.   
Luke is known for his viral crowd-work interactions. These often lead to unusual, yet hilarious encounters. Despite not having much control over his impulsive thoughts, the Australian insists that deep down he means well. This year, he’s on a mission to prove that he really does have good intentions. 
In 2016, Luke went viral with his ‘You don’t own me’ videos. In these, he humorously disobeyed societal norms. His comedy fame has earned him over 600k followers on Instagram. He is also the host of the autobiographical podcast ‘Memoirs of a White Guy’.

id: Urzila Carlson — You Don’t Say-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Urzila Carlson — You Don’t Say
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The trademark cheeky wit is back. South African-Kiwi Urzila Carlson is heading to Wellington with a new show. ‘You Don’t Say’ continues to cement her reputation as an undeniable force in the comedy world. Urzila recently presented this show at the Melbourne International Comedy Festival. There she was awarded People’s Choice Award for the most popular show of the festival. Talking about the upcoming tour she said, “It’s a show born out of sarcasm and storytelling from the mind of a woman who might be slightly out of her mind!” 
This year is huge for the comedy queen. It began with a starring role in rom-com ‘Kinda Pregnant’ alongside Amy Schumer. The film has racked up over 25 million views on Netflix. Later in the year, Urzila will embark on her first national tour of the United States and her biggest tour of the United Kingdom.

id: Rob Beckett — Giraffe-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Rob Beckett — Giraffe
venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Since debuting as a stand-up comic in 2009, British funnyman Rob Beckett has built an impressive career. His new show Giraffe brings his brand of down-to-earth comedy to Wellington’s St James Theatre. From podcasts and radio to hosting, television, and voiceovers, Rob is a versatile comedian. New Zealand audiences might recognise him as one of the winners of the popular show ‘Taskmaster’, or the long-running ‘8 Out of 10 Cats’. He has many other UK television shows to his name including ‘Rob & Romesh Vs.’ and ‘Celebs Go Dating’. Now a father of two, he has focused his lens on the ups and downs of parenting and produces a smash-hit podcast ‘Parenting Hell’.
When asked about leaving his family to tour the other side of the world Rob is unfazed. “My wife thinks it’s going to be tough for me to be away from the family, and don’t get me wrong, I do love my children, but I also enjoy a lie-in and a hotel buffet breakfast. I think I’ll cope.”

id: Nurse John — Short Staffed Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Nurse John — Short Staffed Tour
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
It only hurts when you laugh. The medical-themed comedy of John Dela Cruz is likely to leave you crying, screaming, and laughing. His alter-ego, Nurse John, portrays life working in the healthcare industry. The ‘Nurse John — Short Staffed Tour’ is a delightful romp through the ups and downs of caring for people. It’s proven hilariously relatable to those both in and out of the industry. 
John is a content creator and Los Angeles-based nurse. He’s amassed over 10 million followers across his social media platforms. He’s known for his positive presence online as he documents his day-to-day life. Translating online comedy into a live stage show has proved successful and he now tours regularly. Nurse John’s combination of reality, truth, and entertainment has proved a winner. He inspires millions around the world to believe that with enough caffeine, medication, and hydration…you too can make it to your next shift.

id: Chris Parker — Stop Being So Dramatic!-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Chris Parker — Stop Being So Dramatic!
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
He’s the self-proclaimed People’s Princess of Aotearoa. Funny man Chris Parker is back with a new (and dramatic) stand-up show. Stop Being So Dramatic is his latest creation and it’s heading to The Opera House in July 2025. People have been telling Chris that he’s dramatic since childhood. Now that he’s 34 he’s ready to address the drama queen allegations head-on. Join him for an hour of high-intensity, feverishly paced, and dizzyingly expressive comedy. Chris says, “I’ve cried in every speech I’ve ever delivered publicly, and this year when I slept on my neck weirdly, I may have bought myself an unnecessary neck brace. Still, I’m desperate to prove that I’m really chill and down to earth.”
Chris Parker is a graduate of Wellington drama school Toi Whakaari O Aotearoa. He first built a reputation by posting funny videos on social media. Now he tours live shows and is a regular face on New Zealand TV. See him in ‘7 Days’, ‘Have You Been Paying Attention NZ’, ‘Jono and Ben’, ‘Funny Girls’, ‘Taskmaster, NZ’, and ‘Golden Boy’. He has appeared in feature films ‘Baby Done’, ‘The Breaker Upperers’, and ‘Nude Tuesday’. He has two feature films of his own currently in development.

id: GOMIL — Grumpy Old Man in Lycra-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: GOMIL — Grumpy Old Man in Lycra
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
You may have heard of the phenomenally popular stage show, ‘MAMIL – Middle Aged Man in Lycra’. After playing to over 70,000 people across the country, now comes its laugh-out-loud sequel: ‘GOMIL – Grumpy Old Man in Lycra’. This one-man show stars Kiwi acting royalty Mark Hadlow of ’King Kong’ and ‘The Hobbit’ fame. It’s sure to bring a fresh wave of laughter, Lycra, and life’s absurdities. 
Whether you’re a weekend warrior, a reluctant spouse, or just someone who enjoys watching others sweat the small (and stretchy) stuff, GOMIL is a must-see. This show dives deep into the world of ageing men, fragile egos, friendship, and family. Watch Mark as he explores the undeniable need to keep moving, no matter how creaky your knees may be. 
‘Grumpy Old Man in Lycra’ is a celebration of growing older (and slightly wider) with humour, heart, and a healthy dose of spandex.

id: Aunty Donna — Drem World Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Aunty Donna — Drem World Tour
venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
It’s zany, it’s unpredictable, and it’s heading to The Opera House. Australian surrealist comedy group Aunty Donna is back on the road. The Melbourne-based trio have written a new show called ‘Drem World Tour’. Its first stop is The Opera House in Wellington. The group is known for wild, off-the-wall skits and a penchant for silliness. 
Formed in 2011 the group’s creativity has spawned live shows, a YouTube channel, a podcast, a studio album, and a television series. Their 2020 Netflix series ‘Aunty Donna’s Big Ol’ House of Fun’ further grew their fanbase. Members of the group have cited Monty Python, Shaun Micallef, and The Mighty Boosh as inspirations for their comedy. Join Mark Bonanno, Broden Kelly, and Zachary Ruane as they present a wacky night of comedy.

id: Jim Jefferies – Son of a Carpenter-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Jim Jefferies – Son of a Carpenter
venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
He never fails to light up a crowd with his provocative and biting observations. Australian actor and comic Jim Jefferies is heading to Wellington. His new show, Son of a Carpenter, is further proof that he is one of the most electrifying comedy stars on the scene. He is known for his ability to push boundaries with incisive and intelligent insights. The Times UK says his act “… increasingly finds a beautiful balance between the jagged and the shrewd, the vicious, and the vulnerable.”  
Jim is one of the most popular and respected comedians of his generation. He has released 10 monumental stand-up specials and entertains live audiences across the globe. From New York’s Madison Square Garden to London’s O2 Arena, he consistently leaves sold-out venues in his wake.

id: Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny
venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
One of Britain’s favourite funny exports is bringing a new comedy tour to Wellington. Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny will bring the comedian’s signature dark brand of humour to TSB Arena. The presenter, actor, and writer is known for his one-liners, rapid-fire delivery, and signature laugh. His content is often described as “edgy”, so be prepared for a raised eyebrow or two. Just like a magnet, it attracts some people and repels others. For those who are attracted to risqué jokes with a bit of spice, this is a show not to miss. 
Jimmy Carr has been a comedy staple for British audiences since the late 1990s. He appears as the host of ‘The Big Fat Quiz of the Year’, ‘8 Out of 10 Cats’, and ‘8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown’. He has also taken part in numerous television panel shows, radio shows, and podcasts.

id: Professional Darts Corporation ANZ Premier League-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Professional Darts Corporation ANZ Premier League
venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
It’s a bullseye for lovers of darts. A new Australasian competition will stop off at Wellington’s TSB Arena in November 2025. You’ll be able to watch as darts players aim for glory. The Professional Darts Corporation (PDC) ANZ Premier League acts as a springboard into the 2025/26 World Darts Championship. There are eight positions open to New Zealanders and Australians. The eventual champion heads off to a place in the global competition. 
PDC chief executive Matt Porter describes the new competition as a huge boost for professional darts in the region. “The PDC ANZ Premier League is an exciting moment for us,” he says. “We want to encourage the next generation of stars to emulate the likes of Simon Whitlock, Damon Heta, and Haupai Puha.” Simon Whitlock, known as ‘The Wizard’, has confirmed his return to the big stage for the Wellington show. The European Champion and World Cup of Darts winner will be joined by the famous English darts referee Russ ‘The Voice’ Bray.  They’re both ready to light up the TSB Arena.

id: New Zealand Cricket Home International Season--Wellington NZ
name: New Zealand Cricket Home International Season
description:
It looks like New Zealand Cricket (NZC) has slogged it for six. The 2025-26 international home season of cricket promises an exciting 46 days of action across the country. Wellington has scored six major opportunities to see the BLACKCAPS and WHITE FERNS in action. Four formidable opponents are travelling to New Zealand shores. Australia, England, West Indies, and South Africa will compete across multiple formats. The live T20I action at Sky Stadium and Test matches at Cello Basin Reserve will have Wellington buzzing.
The 2024-25 season saw bumper crowds, so NZC are hoping to build on this exciting momentum. As rising WHITE FERNS star Georgia Plimmer says, “The atmosphere in Wellington — sitting on the bank, having a drink and watching some great cricket — that’s what you want on a summer’s day in New Zealand.”

id: Women’s Amateur Asia-Pacific Championship-Royal Wellington Golf Club, Upper Hutt-Wellington NZ
name: Women’s Amateur Asia-Pacific Championship
venue: Royal Wellington Golf Club, Upper Hutt
description:
It’s a first for New Zealand and a hole lot of fun for golfing enthusiasts. See the Women’s Amateur Asia-Pacific (WAAP) championship at Heretaunga’s Royal Wellington Golf Club in February 2026. This is the eighth edition of WAAP, and the first time in New Zealand. The competition has become the preeminent women’s amateur championship in the Asia-Pacific region.   
Each year, WAAP provides the winner with life-changing opportunities. They gain entry into three global women’s major championships and elite amateur championships. This includes the AIG Women’s Open, the Chevron Championship, Amundi Evian Championship, and the Augusta National Women’s Amateur.

id: All Blacks vs South Africa-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: All Blacks vs South Africa
venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
For Wellington’s second and final major fixture of the 2025 international rugby season, the All Blacks face South Africa in The Rugby Championship. This is also their chance to win back the Freedom Cup. This is gearing up to be one of the most exciting showdowns of the season after two closely fought Tests in South Africa in 2024.
At the 2023 Rugby World Cup, South Africa pipped the All Blacks at the post by one point in the final and took home the prize. South Africa has won the Rugby World Cup a total of four times while New Zealand has brought it home three times. They are well-matched teams so All Blacks Coach Scott Robertson will be training the boys hard. Wellington will be awash with rugby fever so make sure you’re part of the action.

id: Mills Albert Wellington Saints NBL grand final-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Mills Albert Wellington Saints NBL grand final
venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
The Mills Albert Wellington Saints are just one win away from their 13th national title. The Saints will take on the Southland Sharks this Sunday in the NBL Grand Final at TSB Arena in Wellington.
In front of a loud home crowd, the Saints delivered their most complete performance of the season to book their Grand Final spot with a commanding 93-68 victory over the Tauranga Whai. Tickets are on sale now.

id: Wrexham Down Under presented by La Trobe Financial-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Wrexham Down Under presented by La Trobe Financial
venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
description:
Ahead of their next Championship season, Welsh football club Wrexham AFC are heading down under for the first time to play some pre-season games. They’ll be bringing their energy and star quality to Wellington in their only New Zealand match.
The Red Dragons will fly into the pitch at Sky Stadium in July to face off with the Phoenix. They’ll be taking on Melbourne Victory at home, and Sydney FC before crossing the ditch to New Zealand.

id: Hot Wheels Monster Trucks Live: Glow-N-Fire-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Hot Wheels Monster Trucks Live: Glow-N-Fire
venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
description: Hot Wheels just got a whole lot bigger. After a sold-out tour of Australia, Hot Wheels Monster Trucks Live™ Glow-N-Fire is coming to Wellington. This high-octane extravaganza brings the joy and creativity of Hot Wheels to New Zealand for the first time. See the ultimate monster truck show at a larger-than-life scale — with a fiery twist.

id: Whānau Mārama New Zealand International Film Festival--Wellington NZ
name: Whānau Mārama New Zealand International Film Festival
description:
Lights, camera, action — the largest film festival in the country is back. Celebrating 57 years, the Whānau Mārama New Zealand International Film Festival is gearing up for 10 action-packed days in August. The annual festival presents over 150 feature films, short films, and documentaries. 
There’s always a huge and diverse selection of films to choose from. Artistic Director Paolo Bertolin and his team of film curators have scoured the world for independent, quirky, and award-winning movies. These include a politically charged near-future drama from Brazil, an Australian animated queer space opera, and a restored ‘70s horror classic. There’s also a haunting psychological drama set in remote Aotearoa. 
Paolo says these films are indicative of the energy shaping this year’s festival. They provide a taste of the adventurous and memorable stories awaiting audiences. “These films speak powerfully to the moment we are living in. They ask big questions, take risks, and remind us why cinema matters more than ever.”

id: Beervana-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
name: Beervana
venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
description: Beervana is back and bringing the best craft beers to Wellington’s Sky Stadium. Held over two days, Beervana is New Zealand’s ultimate celebration of good beer. It’s perfect for anyone (over 18) who wants to know more about beer, try an interesting brew, or just have a fun beer-themed day out.

id: Wairarapa Festival of Christmas--Wellington NZ
name: Wairarapa Festival of Christmas
description:
Greytown is getting ready for one of the country’s happiest mid-winter celebrations. The Wairarapa Festival of Christmas is an extravaganza blending northern hemisphere charm with Kiwi flair. The month of festivities includes lights, laughter, and fun for all ages. This year’s theme, ‘Christmas Carnival’, applies to events including a Light Up Tractor Parade, Illumination Night Walk, and Kids Circus School Programme. There are also street parties, house tours, live music, and fireworks.
The main street in Greytown provides the hub for many activities across the four weeks. It will offer twinkling lights, themed shopfronts, delicious street food, and live entertainment. The mid-winter Christmas magic will be enhanced by the promise of a special snow delivery, too. Get ready to have a cracker of a celebration.

id: Visa Wellington On a Plate--Wellington NZ
name: Visa Wellington On a Plate
description:
New Zealand’s favourite foodie fest is back. For the whole month of August, Visa Wellington On a Plate (VWOAP) brings culinary delights to hospitality venues across the city and region. Expect everything from creative events, delicious pop-up restaurants, and the beloved Burger Wellington. 
This year, the festival theme is ‘Food is love’. It's a tribute to the joy of connecting over kai and the capital’s vibrant, resilient hospitality scene. “We want August to feel like one big love letter to the city and the incredible people who call it home. There’s an event or burger to suit every budget and every taste,” says Festival Director Beth Brash. The 2025 VWOAP programme serves up over 100 love-themed events and more than 200 burgers.

id: CubaDupa--Wellington NZ
name: CubaDupa
description:
One weekend every March, CubaDupa takes over some of Wellington’s central city streets for an epic party. The free annual festival brings a carnival vibe to the end of the summer. It offers live music, street theatre, dance, parades, and other cultural experiences. 
CubaDupa is New Zealand’s largest outdoor arts and music festival. It takes place over two days on Cuba Street and the surrounding roads, right in the heart of Wellington. The festival is suitable for the whole family with performances and activities running throughout the day and night. Multiple performance spaces showcase New Zealand’s emerging musical talent alongside established artists. The lineup usually includes over 140 local and international acts.
